issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
If RM HA is enabled and used Zookeeper store for RM State Store.
If for any reason Any app gets rejected and directly goes to NEW to FAILED
then final transition makes that to RMApps and Completed Apps memory structure but that doesn't make it to State store.
Now when RMApps default limit reaches it starts deleting apps from memory and store. In that case it try to delete this app from store and fails which causes RM to crash.

Thanks,
Mayank
fields.summary: RM crashes if App gets rejected for any reason and HA is enabled

comments.body:
Updating patch , Adding app to state store in App reject event to make RM memory and state store consistent.

Thanks,
Mayank

This message is automatically generated.

Mayank, thanks for working on the issue.  The current change saves the initial state, but doesn't store the final state and diagnostics of the app. And RM will retry this app if not saving the final state.  I think we should do the following as New_saving state is handling it.
{code}
.addTransition(RMAppState.NEW, RMAppState.FINAL_SAVING,
       RMAppEventType.APP_REJECTED,
       new FinalSavingTransition(new AppRejectedTransition(),
           RMAppState.FAILED))
{code}

Attaching patch after oflline discussion with [~jianhe]

Thanks,
Mayank

Can we please add two more tests for future proofing this?
 - Add one in TestRMRestart to get an app rejected and make sure that the final-status gets recorded
 - Another one in RMStateStoreTestBase to ensure it is okay to have an updateApp call without a storeApp call like in this case.
